resources.string:
Are you ready?
 • 5~20 minutes without interruption
 • Find a place you can sit comfortably
 • Blood Pressure monitor
 	 ‣ With the cuff on your left arm
 • Pulse oximeter
 	 ‣ On your left hand finger (not thumb)
 • Valsalva box and tube\ 	 ‣ Power connected (red light on)

Checking pulse oximeter connection…
 • Place pulse oximeter on your finger
 • Wait for green light and numbers
 • Numbers appear on screen when connected
 • Re-enter this page to reconnect

The subject questions find out your body status.
 
Share your experience (if applicable) on
 • menstruating
 • CPAP usage
Have your period started since the last study day?
How long did you use CPAP in the past 24 hours?

The protocol questions find out your body status.
 
Share your experience (if applicable) on
 • noticing breathing
 • multi-part strength
How many times did you take >= 30 seconds to focus on your breathing in the past 24 hours?
Perform three Breathing Exercises.\n \u2022 Enter the following values for each of them
(Optional) What successes or difficulties have you experienced during the Breathing Exercises?
(Optional) What changes have you noticed during the last week?

The day questions find out how you have been doing and feeling.
 
Share your experience on
 • daily activities
 • emotional functioning
 • social interactions
How long did you sleep last night?
Please rate your sleepiness today.\n \u2022 From 0 = none to 10 = extremely high
Did you experience anything out of your normal routine in the past 24 hours?
If yes, please write a brief description of what happened.
Answer the following for the past 24 hours:
How often have you felt things were going your way?
How often have you felt difficulties were piling up so high that you could not overcome them?
How often have you experienced little interest or little pleasure in doing things?
How often have you felt down, depressed or hopeless?
How often have you felt nervous, anxious or on edge?
How often have you not been able to stop or control worrying?

How much did you exercise today?
 • Minimal: < 10 mins light exercise
 • Low: >= 10 mins light exercise
 • Medium: >= 60 mins light exercise
 	 or >= 30 mins moderate exercise
 • High: >= 180 mins light exercise
 	 or >= 60 mins moderate exercise
 	 or >= 20 mins vigorous exercise
Take the blood pressure measurements.\n \u2022 Enter the following values\n
Sit comfortably and enjoy a rest.\n \u2022 The rest ends when the timer is finished
Wait for the screen to change.\n \u2022 The rest ends when the timer is finished
Breathe normally and take off the valsalsa tube.\n \u2022 The rest ends when the timer is finished
Wait for the screen to change.\n \u2022 The rest ends when the timer is finished
Breathe normally.\n \u2022 The rest ends when the timer is finished

Ready for Valsalva Challenge!
 
 Steps of Valsalva Challenge:
 • Once you begin, a rest period will start
 • Wait for the screen to change
 • Take a deep breath, then blow into the valsalsa tube so the green light is on
 • When the screen changes back, a second rest period will start
 • Breathe normally and take off the valsalsa tube
 • Wait till end of second rest period
Take a deep breath, then blow into the tube so the green light is on.\n

Ready for Breath Hold Challenge!
 
 Steps of Breath Hold Challenge:
 • Once you begin, a rest period will start
 • Wait for the screen to change
 • Breathe all the way out, breath in fully, and hold
 • When the screen changes back, a second rest period will start
 • Breathe normally
 • Wait till end of second rest period
Breathe all the way out, breath in fully, and hold.\n

Ready for Reaction Time Test!
 
Steps of Reaction Time Test:
 • When you see a red dot, tap the screen
Tap the red dot when it appears on the screen.\n

Ready for Stroop Challenge!
 
Steps of Stroop Challenge:
 • Names of colors appear on the screen
 • Pick the color of a word by ignoring the actual text
Pick the color of a word by ignoring the actual text.\n

Ready for Breathing Awareness!
 
Steps of Breathing Awareness:
 • Sit comfortably for about 10 minutes
 • Follow the music to practice your breathing
Follow the music to practice your breathing.\n
You have finished today’s sleep study.
